Description: Two joining sherds of body of North Ionian pottery bowl; cream slip; interior: part of three friezes separated by bands with added red bands probably once lined in white; above, probably lotus and bud; centre, most of goat grazing to right amid thick filling ornament; below, part of rosette fill, Exterior: two friezes separated by bands with added red band lined in white; above, goats grazing to left; below, goat to right; thick filling ornament; much added red inside and out.
Curator's comments: GR 1924,1201,235, 943-949 and 971 probably all belong to the same bowl, with some doubt about 948a; on the inside it has key maeander at the rim above lotus and bud frieze; there are two goat friezes below. Outside has key maeander at rim, black-figure animals in handle zone, and two goat friezes below, above a lotus band near the foot. On 948a there appears the only goat with reversed head.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.207)
